availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Boyle County, Kentucky, farmer. Kentucky native. Married to Mary Frances Sleet on March 9, 1829. Father of James A. Peter, Sarah A. Peter, Jesse C. Peter, Lucy A. Peter, Mallory M. Peter, Richard Peter, and Isabella Peter. Farmer in Boyle County in 1850 and 1860. Owned eleven enslaved persons in Boyle County in 1850.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 1, p. 329A.
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, District 1, p. 6.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Boyle County, p. 133.
Marriage Records: Kentucky Marriages, (Richmond, KY: Madison County Courthouse), film no. 000191852, p. 547.
Find A Grave, "Jordan Peter (1808-1866)," Memorial #84750134, https://www.findagrave.com/memorial/84750134# (accessed December 19, 2018).
